intro: Echium hoffmannseggii, commonly known as Hoffmann's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Echium hoffmannseggii is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and arid conditions.
